text: Pegoscapus bacataensis is a species of fig wasp in the genus Pegoscapus which is native to Colombia.Distribution Pegoscapus bacataensis - Natural History Museum, London It has an obligate mutualism with Ficus andicola, the fig species it pollinates.Jansen & Sarmiento, 2008 It was first described by Sergio Jansen and Carlos Sarmiento in 2008.Pegoscapus bacataensis - Insectoid.info The egg stage of Pegoscapus bacataensis is around 130 days, longer than other pollinating fig wasps.Jansen & Sarmiento, 2008 == Etymology == Pegoscapus bacataensis is named after Bacatá, the name for the Bogotá savanna in Muysccubun, the language of the indigenous Muisca. == See also == *List of flora and fauna named after the Muisca == References == === Bibliography === * == External links == Category:Agaonidae Category:Pollinator wasps Category:Arthropods of Colombia Category:Altiplano Cundiboyacense Bacata Category:Hymenoptera of South America Category:Insects described in 2008
title: Pegoscapus bacataensis
